title: First Blood (movie): Why wasn't John Rambo incarcerated for life following the events in First Blood? - Quora

response.answer_text: We don’t know the exact sentence. He was offered presidential pardon IF he agreed in running a reconnassaince black ops mission. As Dave Younie mentioned in the comment, in the beginning of FIRST BLOOD PART II Trautman says: “You don’t wan’t to spend another ten years in here, don’t you?” This probaly means a 10–15 sentence against a life time jail for first degree murder. Why’s that? The helicopter pilot probably testified about Galt’s behaviour and being Rambo a medal of Honour recipient he was given a very light sentence for involuntary manslaugter. Once Rambo accepted accepted the mission he accomplished it against / far beyond the orders he received (he turned the reconnassaince mission into a rescue mission with open field firefights) but was pardoned anyway. Rambo dies in David Morrell’s novel that created the character. So, the novel that created it all feature no Rambo receiving any sentence.

Rambo was in prison at the beginning of First Blood Part II, but was offered a pardon if he agreed to a mission.  Or...he was in prison until the movie producers figured out there was more money to be made by sequels.
